alert.note: Alert for Orleans (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 12:13PM EST until December 20 at 12:51AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Vermont... Barton River Near Coventry affecting Orleans County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Barton River near Coventry. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Maple Street and River Road between Orleans and Coventry Station will flood. There will be extensive field and lowland flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 9.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 AM EST Tuesday was 9.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.2 feet on 04/20/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1215 AM EST.
